result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather A Paquin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather A Paquin

records.addlTxt: Case is resolved.

Defendant Heather A Paquin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Heather A Paquin.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
NO CONTEST to the charge in count 1, disorderly conduct.  Convicted 
State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted. 
Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for five (5) days, time served.  Court imposes costs in the amount of $443.00 due in 60 days or 8 days jail for failure to pay.  DNA sample also ordered. 
Defendant has 5 days credit.
Letter from Attorney Heim to MRR requesting bail modification.
Plea date on October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:39 am - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather A Paquin appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Luke Harrison appeared by video for Heather A Paquin. Not guilty pleas.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling conference on October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Further proceedings on September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.
Prints to MTPD.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 7-28-2022 at 10:30 in B-15.  Previously furnished recognizance bond is modified to $100 cash with the condition that she have no contact with L.A.G. DOB: 8-22-62 or the Carriage Hill Apartments located at 1901 Waldo Blvd., Manitowoc, WI. Cash bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD. 
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon. 
Minutes.

Warrant served. 
Def. in custody in Ozaukee Co. 
WARRANT FEES: $190.98

DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.
Prints to MTPD.

Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 7-21-2022 at 10:30am in B-15.  $250 recognizance bond previously furnished is continued with all prior conditions. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.

WARRANT FEES: $228.18

Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather A Paquin not in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel in court for Heather A Paquin.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Nathan Heim, Public Defender.
Re:  Disorderly conduct, on 06-10-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-30-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $250.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with L.A.G., DOB: 08-22-62 or the Carriage Hill Apartments located at 1901 Waldo Blvd., Manitowoc, WI.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
